p: The second axis of the PCA accounted for 31.78% of the total inertia, and a clear‐cut separation appeared in between Tm‐a and the three others groups. Tm‐t plants had greater amounts of fructose 6‐phosphate (F6P), glucose 6‐phosphate (G6P), isoleucine, leucine, trehalose, and threonine (Figures 3a,b and 4). ANOVA analyses revealed that valine, isoleucine, and leucine had lower concentrations ( p value < .003, Figure 4f–h) in Am independently of condition (Am‐a or Am‐t), and also in Tm‐t, than in Tm‐a.
